main event: A report was received about a 'flying saucer' observed over Brooklyn heading for Idlewild Airport on February 23, 1957.
interesting points: The object was reported to have circled Idlewild Airport, which is one of the world's busiest airports., The observation was passed from the New York Journal Herald to the 1st Army and then to the USAF., The witness described the object as a 'flying saucer.', No other witnesses were confirmed despite heavy air traffic and a million people nearby., The report concluded that it might have been a mistaken phenomenon.
